alert.note: Alert for Franklin (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 29 at 8:41PM EDT until August 29 at 11:45PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Franklin County in central North Carolina... * Until 1145 PM EDT. * At 841 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Louisburg. This includes the following flood prone locations... Fox Creek at East River Rd. and Hwy 56. Bennett Perry Rd. at Perry`s Pond. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
